headline.print_headline: US to Start Training Libyan Soldiers at Midyear
headline.main: US to Start Training Libyan Soldiers at Midyear

docs.snippet: The top U.S. military commander for Africa says the Pentagon is planning to begin training 5,000 to 8,000 Libyan soldiers by midyear to help bolster the nation's security. The U.S. is also looking into providing additional airlift assistance to So...
docs.lead_paragraph: The top U.S. military commander for Africa says the Pentagon is planning to begin training 5,000 to 8,000 Libyan soldiers by midyear to help bolster the nation's security. The U.S. is also looking into providing additional airlift assistance to South Sudan, where violence has killed more than 1,000 people and driven 180,000 from their homes in the last month.

headline.print_headline: West Virginia Chemical Spill Cuts Water Supply for Thousands
headline.main: West Virginia Chemical Spill Cuts Water Supply for Thousands

docs.snippet: About 100,000 homes and businesses in West Virginia were being told on Thursday not to use tap water for drinking, cooking or bathing following a chemical spill along the Elk River in Charleston, the state's capital, according to local officials....
docs.lead_paragraph: About 100,000 homes and businesses in West Virginia were being told on Thursday not to use tap water for drinking, cooking or bathing following a chemical spill along the Elk River in Charleston, the state's capital, according to local officials.

headline.main: For PC Makers, the Good News on 2013 Is That It Is Over

docs.snippet: Last year was the first in which personal computer shipments fell at a double-digit percentage rate, according to two leading market-research companies....
docs.abstract: Last year was the first in which personal computer shipments fell at a double-digit percentage rate, according to two leading market-research companies.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Could Train Elite Iraqi Forces in Jordan
headline.main: U.S. Could Train Elite Iraqi Forces in Jordan

docs.snippet: The Obama administration is considering providing new training to elite Iraqi forces in Jordan as U.S. officials seek ways to help the government of Iraqi Prime Minister Nuri al-Maliki repel an al Qaeda campaign near its western border....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is considering providing new training to elite Iraqi forces in Jordan as U.S. officials seek ways to help the government of Iraqi Prime Minister Nuri al-Maliki repel an al Qaeda campaign near its western border.

headline.print_headline: AO: Nadal, Murray, Federer All in the Same Half
headline.main: AO: Nadal, Murray, Federer All in the Same Half

docs.snippet: As three-time defending champion Novak Djokovic held the Australian Open trophy in a photo shoot before Friday's draw, he joked that having his fingerprints on it may in some way help him win the title for a fourth consecutive year....
docs.lead_paragraph: As three-time defending champion Novak Djokovic held the Australian Open trophy in a photo shoot before Friday's draw, he joked that having his fingerprints on it may in some way help him win the title for a fourth consecutive year.

docs.snippet: Brian Boitano never intended to publicly reveal he is gay until he was chosen for the U.S. Olympic delegation by President Barack Obama last month....
docs.lead_paragraph: Brian Boitano never intended to publicly reveal he is gay until he was chosen for the U.S. Olympic delegation by President Barack Obama last month.

headline.print_headline: Scott Has a Surfer for a Fill-In Caddie
headline.main: Scott Has a Surfer for a Fill-In Caddie

docs.snippet: Benji Weatherley has been to Portugal and South Africa, to Hawaii and the south of France, just about everywhere a pro surfer would want to go. And yet one of the biggest thrills of his life happened Thursday just down the coast from Waikiki Beach...
docs.lead_paragraph: Benji Weatherley has been to Portugal and South Africa, to Hawaii and the south of France, just about everywhere a pro surfer would want to go. And yet one of the biggest thrills of his life happened Thursday just down the coast from Waikiki Beach.

headline.print_headline: Nadal to Face Local Hope Tomic in Australian Open
headline.main: Nadal to Face Local Hope Tomic in Australian Open

docs.snippet: World number one Rafal Nadal will play local hope Bernard Tomic in the first round of the Australian Open as he bids for a 14th grand slam title....
docs.lead_paragraph: World number one Rafal Nadal will play local hope Bernard Tomic in the first round of the Australian Open as he bids for a 14th grand slam title.

headline.print_headline: 6 Cuban Asylum-Seekers Stuck at Bogota Airport
headline.main: 6 Cuban Asylum-Seekers Stuck at Bogota Airport

docs.snippet: Colombia refused on Thursday to entertain asylum applications from six Cubans who have been stuck in the transit area of Bogota's international airport since New Year's Day after a failed attempt to enter Ecuador....
docs.lead_paragraph: Colombia refused on Thursday to entertain asylum applications from six Cubans who have been stuck in the transit area of Bogota's international airport since New Year's Day after a failed attempt to enter Ecuador.

headline.print_headline: Robert Pastor: Ex-US Official, Americas Expert
headline.main: Robert Pastor: Ex-US Official, Americas Expert

docs.snippet: Robert A. Pastor, an influential scholar and policymaker who spent decades working for better inter-American relations and democracy and free elections in the Western Hemisphere, has died after a three-year battle with cancer. He was 66....
docs.lead_paragraph: Robert A. Pastor, an influential scholar and policymaker who spent decades working for better inter-American relations and democracy and free elections in the Western Hemisphere, has died after a three-year battle with cancer. He was 66.
